main.name: sound
main.description: The `sound` objects holds all the audio related things. Sounds will automatically be added when you load an audio file with `Game.assets`.

children.name: load
children.description: Add a sound (`<audio>` element) to the Game. Works like `Game.assets.load()`.

arguments.name: sound/URL
arguments.description: The audio element that holds the sound, or the URL where the audio file is located. Same as in `Game.assets.load()`.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The optional, unique name of this sound, so you can easily play it later on.

children.name: get
children.description: Get the sound with the given name or URL.

arguments.name: URL/name
arguments.description: The name or URL of the sound to get. Used exactly as `Game.assets.load()`.

children.name: play
children.description: Play the sound with given name. This actually just perfomrs a `get()` and executes `.play()` on the result.

arguments.name: name/URL
arguments.description: The name or URL of the sound, as passed to `Game.sound.get()`.
